name: Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority
overview: The Washington Metro, operated by WMATA, is the rapid transit system serving the Washington metropolitan area. It is the second-busiest rapid transit system in the United States and serves the District of Columbia, along with portions of Maryland and Virginia.

history.title: System Opens
history.description: Metro opens with the first segment of the Red Line between Rhode Island Avenue and Farragut North, comprising 4.6 miles and 5 stations.

history.title: Blue Line Opens
history.description: Blue Line service begins between National Airport and Stadium-Armory.

history.title: Orange Line Opens
history.description: Orange Line begins service between New Carrollton and Ballston.

history.title: Green Line Opens
history.description: Green Line opens between U Street and Anacostia.

history.title: System Completed
history.description: The original 103-mile Adopted Regional System is completed with the opening of the Green Line to Branch Avenue.

history.title: Silver Line Phase 1
history.description: Silver Line Phase 1 opens, extending service to Tysons Corner and Reston.

history.title: Silver Line Phase 2
history.description: Silver Line Phase 2 opens, extending service to Dulles International Airport and Loudoun County.
